name: WP Lean Analytics
author: WP Service Agent, Germany

sections.description:
The WP Lean Analytics provides a lean and compliant integration with Google Analytics, social platforms, and Smartlook recorder that allows you to track your users as desired while not slowing down your Website with stuff you don’t need.
Also you do not need to authenticate with any third party service – so your private tracking data stays your data.
This plugin is recommended, if you do NOT want a dashboard within your admin panel and rather use the third party dashboards directly.
No coding required.

Check out WP Lean Analytics

Features:

FREE version features:

✅ Easy to use configuration wizard to setup tracking (no coding required)
✅ Tracking on all frontend pages (with toggle)
✅ Tracking on WordPress login & registration pages (with toggle)
✅ Tracking in WordPress admin panel (with toggle)
✅ Tracking for logged in users (with toggle)
✅ Anonymize-IP functionality for Google Analytics (with toggle)
✅ Integration with WP Consent Manager (tracking code is disabled, if customers opt-out)
✅ Lean coding, so it won’t slow down your website

PRO version features:

✅ All features of FREE version
✅ Unified event-tracking for Google Analytics, social platforms and Smartlook

If you want to learn more, visit WP Lean Analytics
sections.installation:
From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New’
  2. Search for ‘WP Lean Analytics’
  3. Install the plugin from the WordPress directory
  4. Activate the plugin on your plugins page

From WordPress.org – via WordPress

  1. Download the plugin (zip-file)
  2. Visit ‘Plugins > Add New > Upload Plugin’
  3. Select the file from your download folder and upload it to WordPress
  4. Activate the plugin on your plugins page

From WordPress.org – via FTP

  1. Download the plugin (zip-file)
  2. Unzip the zip-file (will create a wp-lean-analytics directory)
  3. Upload the “wp-lean-analytics” directory to your “/wp-content/plugins/” directory, using your favorite method (ftp, sftp, scp, etc…)
  4. Activate the plugin from your plugins page

Configuring the plugin

  1. After activating the plugin a “WP Lean Analytics” link will be added to the admin menu
  2. Clicking that link to visit the plugin’s dashboard
  3. Start the configuration wizard which will guide you through the settings process
sections.faq:
Where can I get support?

Just visit us on WP Service Agent and ask your question.
sections.changelog:
1.1.0

  • Tested compatibility with WordPress 5.4
  • Fixed WP Consent Manager integration
  • Added links to support in dashboard
  • Set the default for tracking on login/registration pages to “false”
  • Updated readme.txt installation instructions
  • Added links to PRO-version in dashboard
  • Removed brands of social platforms

1.0.0

  • Initial version released
